Client: HSBC North America
Description: The Comprehensive Capital Analysis and Review (CCAR) is an annual exercise by the Federal Reserve to ensure that institutions have well-defined and forward-looking capital planning processes that account for their unique risks and sufficient capital to continue operations through times of economic and financial stress.

As part of the CCAR, the Federal Reserve evaluates capital adequacy, internal capital adequacy assessment processes, and plans to make capital distributions, such as dividend payments or stock repurchases. The CCAR includes a supervisory stress test to support the Federal Reserve's analysis of the adequacy of capital. Boards of directors are required each year to review and approve capital plans before submitting them to the Federal Reserve.

Project Details:

	Project1: Reporting – Orahi                                                  Feb 2019 – May 2019



Client	          :Orahi
Languages	:AWS Redshift, Python, Qlik

Description: 
Orahi is into tracking business and currently they have close to 50 schools whose busses are being tracked by Orahi. Parents use the Orahi Locate app to track their kids’ school busses. Their current data base is in Mongo (unstructured data base). The Operations team in Orahi did not have a proper reporting tool which tells them the busses not run or stops not covered or any issues they face daily. They had to manually check everything via their dashboard and apps. 

My work involved creating a database (warehouse) on cloud (AWS Redshift) and getting the required data from Mongo database and creating the following reports

· Busses run and not run details for last 10 days
· The time at which the busses are covering the respective stops and the stops not covering.
· The stops at which the notifications are not triggered to parents.
· The busses which are reaching school on time/late.
So, with these reports, it’s easy for the operation team to take actions quickly before the parents/school admins complain.


	Project2: Direct Billing – Orahi                                                 May 2019 – Till Date



Client	          : Orahi
Languages	: AWS Redshift, AWS RDS, Qlik

Description: 

Orahi is currently getting paid by schools for their business. But now, they are acquiring more schools where the payment will be made directly from the parents and not through the schools. The current data related to Orahi App users are in RDS server. 

My work involved in creating a warehouse to track the users who have downloaded the app, paid for the services, the frequency of using the app, the last time they logged into the app etc. With the details of the users, I have created reports which show the parents who have not paid, but likely to pay for the services. So operation team used to send the msgs/obd calls to such users and get the payments made. I am also creating the reports which show the sms/obd calls made and the respective payments made and analyzing what makes the parents pay for the app.   

	Project3: Mobility – Orahi                                                        May 2019 – Till Date



Client	          : Orahi
Languages	: AWS RDS, Mongo

Description: 
Orahi is stepping into a new business on mobility for Sweden users where they want to track their elderly parents who are not staying with them. In Sweden, privacy is a big concern and CCTV cameras are not a solution. This project is limited only to the usage in the house premises and not really tracking them. There will be sensors installed in all the rooms which will send the data to our data base (Mongo) each time when there is movement. The data also says the type of movement involved, whether it’s a normal activity or an abnormal activity. Depending on that, alerts will be sent to the respective persons. 

My work involves creation of a data base to capture all the details and create reports on daily basis and shows the user where their parents are spending more time, room wise. This project is still on a design phase and development has not started on it yet.


	Project4: MIS – EIG                                                             Jun 2009 – Jan 2013



Client	          : Equity Insurance Group (EIG), UK
Organization	: CGI, Mumbai
Languages	: SSIS, SQL server 2008, SSRS
Tools	          : Sera dimension, Service center.
Team size	: 4

Description: 

EIG is one of UK’s largest motor insurers and has been providing insurance products for more than around 60 years. It provides insurance to around 1 million policyholders and insures around one in three motorcycles in the UK. MIS application covers development of dataware house applications for EIG. There was already robust system for Home insurance whose daily monitoring activities have to be carried out.  The similar project had to be developed in motor insurance as well.

· Communication with the business users/onsite team and understand the exact requirements.

· Creating and changing the SSRS reports according to the requirements. 
· Unit testing of the change requests and providing UAT support
· Documentation of the technical spec.
· Release management through Sera dimension. Make the code ready for release through dimension and resolving any merge issues
· Supporting the production jobs and ensuring the smooth functioning of it. 
· Involved in training of the new members of the MIS project. 

	Project5: Data Connector Module                                     April 2008 – October 2008


Client	               : Abbey National Bank, UK
Organization	 : ITC Infotech, Bangalore
Languages/Tools : Oracle – PL/SQL, JCL, Attachmate – simulator, Visio, MS project

Description: 

Abbey National bank is the 7th largest bank in the retail banking. Abbey National bank was acquired by another bank, Santandar. So a core-banking solution had to be implemented in Abbey and as a result many small banking applications running in Abbey had to be migrated to their centralized database. Data Connector Module provides an interface to load the Home Insurance data to the central database. The different files which DCM will receive are Premium_Quote, Risk, Receipt, Risk_Receipt and SPP (Sales Process Platform). A data model had to be created to accommodate all the data from these files and then PL/SQL blocks had to be written for processing the data from the files.



Roles & Responsibilities: 

· Communication with the client and understand the exact requirements.
· Created the data model and normalized the tables.
· Wrote various PL/SQL blocks to load the data, and to process them.
· Wrote the JCL scripts to call the PL/SQL scripts.
· Unit testing of the various modules.
· Releasing the code through PVCS dimension.
· Involved in the recruitment of 3 new members for this project right from selecting from the resume, fixing the appointment with the candidates, telephonic round of interview till the managerial round.

The daily transactions from the bank are sent to these systems in the form of datafiles. These applications process the data from the file and load them into the respective tables. This application will be used by the mediators who enter the customers’ details to the system and scores will be generated depending on the various information of the customer. Bank authorities checks the scores and they decide on giving the loan or how much loan to be given to the customer

Abbey National bank is the 7th largest bank in the retail banking. Abbey National bank was acquired by another bank, Santandar. So a core-banking solution had to be implemented in Abbey and as a result many small banking applications running in Abbey had to be migrated to their centralized database. Data Connector Module provides an interface to load the Home Insurance data to the central database. The different files which DCM will receive are Premium_Quote, Risk, Receipt, Risk_Receipt and SPP (Sales Process Platform). A data model had to be created to accommodate all the data from these files and then PL/SQL blocks had to be written for processing the data from the files.

EIG is one of UK’s largest motor insurers and has been providing insurance products for more than around 60 years. It provides insurance to around 1 million policyholders and insures around one in three motorcycles in the UK. MIS application covers development of dataware house applications for EIG. There was already robust system for Home insurance whose daily monitoring activities have to be carried out.  The similar project had to be developed in motor insurance as well

Orahi is stepping into a new business on mobility for Sweden users where they want to track their elderly parents who are not staying with them. In Sweden, privacy is a big concern and CCTV cameras are not a solution. This project is limited only to the usage in the house premises and not really tracking them. There will be sensors installed in all the rooms which will send the data to our data base (Mongo) each time when there is movement. The data also says the type of movement involved, whether it’s a normal activity or an abnormal activity. Depending on that, alerts will be sent to the respective persons

My work involved in creating a warehouse to track the users who have downloaded the app, paid for the services, the frequency of using the app, the last time they logged into the app etc. With the details of the users, I have created reports which show the parents who have not paid, but likely to pay for the services. So operation team used to send the msgs/obd calls to such users and get the payments made. I am also creating the reports which show the sms/obd calls made and the respective payments made and analyzing what makes the parents pay for the app.

Orahi is currently getting paid by schools for their business. But now, they are acquiring more schools where the payment will be made directly from the parents and not through the schools. The current data related to Orahi App users are in RDS server

Orahi is into tracking business and currently they have close to 50 schools whose busses are being tracked by Orahi. Parents use the Orahi Locate app to track their kids’ school busses. Their current data base is in Mongo (unstructured data base). The Operations team in Orahi did not have a proper reporting tool which tells them the busses not run or stops not covered or any issues they face daily. They had to manually check everything via their dashboard and apps.
Bachelors in Computers Application from PES Institute of Technology, Bangalore in the year 2004 with 84%
Masters Programme in Information Technology  From Symbiosis Centre for Information Technology, Pune in the year 2006 with a CGPA of 2.9 out of 4.0

6+ years’ experience in the information technology industry, with a wide range of experience providing development, maintenance and support of applications in technologies like AWS Redshift, SSIS, SSRS, SQl server, UNIX shell scripting and Oracle – PL/SQL
Having more than 6 years’ experience in Data base management and Date Warehouse projects in development and maintenance projects, looking for a suitable position in the software industry

Title			:   JSW Plant Operations Dashboard (JPOD)

Description:
JSW Plant Operations Dashboard (JPOD) has been architected to be a robust, scalable, stable & easy to use solution, built upon a solid advanced Java framework, to enhance the production process & capability of all JSW Plants across the country.
JPOD is an integrated information system focused on capturing real-time plant operations data from the Level 1, Level 2, and Level 3 systems available at the individual process units of JSW Vijayanagar.  JPOD is a part of M.E.S (Manufacturing Execution System) whose immediate objective is to enable online availability of DPR (Daily Production Report) and Unit level reports for both current date and historical analysis.

 Role                     	:   Development and Support

Client			:   JSW Steel Ltd- Vijayanagar
Role                    	:   Enhancement and Support
Team Size                          : 14
Duration		:   Oct 2012 to till date (Development & enhancement)
Technologies 	 :   JSTL, Spring IOC, Spring MVC, Spring JDBC, Oracle10g, Tomcat 6.0, Eclipse3.0, Ajax, JavaScript, Log4j.

Description:
MES is the intranet based large enterprise application which is used across the JSW location. MES is the demanding application for JSW Steel. There are many departments-JSW which have dependency on MES.  It has many interfaces which generate data accordingly for MES. The main purpose of this application is to make their CRM (Cold Roll Mill) automated and online for all their business needs. There are two main interfaces which are SAP and L2 automation.
SAP and L2 (Automation System) which facilitate to capture order data and HR _COIL details   from SAPinto the system which is the starting point of this project. Then it flows to planning module where promise date for each order will be provided and material will be scheduled and send to L2 for production. This data goes to the production department. Production module captures production process data to process the material (coil) in 7 consecutive lines and each and every line to production detail which will send to SAP for production confirmation and UD details will also send to SAP which will send a acknowledge to MES  then only next line production will be start otherwise it will not be schedule for further processing  the final information to the quality department, after clearance from quality TC will be generate on the basis of quality clearance data will flow back to SAP .There are many transaction screens and reports in each module of  the MES application. 


Project #5:
Title			:   SPCL (Steel Processing Company Ltd.)

Client			:   JSW Steel Ltd- Vijayanagar
Role                   	:   Development and Support
Team Size                          : 14
Duration		:   Oct 2012 to till date (Development & enhancement)
Technologies 	:   JSTL, Spring IOC, Spring MVC, Spring JDBC, Oracle10g, Tomcat 6.0, Eclipse, Ajax, JavaScript, Log4j.
Description:        
The purpose of this project is to build an integrated application for the JSW-SPCL Industry for the Smooth Production and Stock Tracking System at SPCL for HRPO/CRCA material. SPCL project is extension of MES-CRM project. In SPCL, material will be processed further in slitting and cut-to-length lines. This application will support the entire process from order entry to dispatch and serves as an information conduit between mill operations and the SAP system.

· Involved in analysis of project functional flow so as to decide how effectively data can be captured, stored, processed and displayed.

· Involved in database design for developing package, function and procedure implementations.
· Worked for integration of various databases with a common database by processing the data available in PLCs of various units.
· Developed interface procedures in PL/SQL to process the data available in the database and to maintain synchronization between two databases.
· Created tables, views, sequences and developed PL/SQL stored procedures and triggers.
· Enforced database integrity using primary keys and foreign keys.
· Created PL/SQL functions to facilitate business functions and calculations
· Developed PL/SQL procedures & functions to support the reports by retrieving the data from various databases.
· Designed view and result jsp pages using html, JavaScript, jsp technologies as per the requirements.
· Developed various reports for viewing the data available in the database.
